alert.note: Alert for Dickson; Hickman; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT DICKSON...SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY...SOUTHERN STEWART...HOUSTON...HUMPHREYS AND NORTHERN HICKMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CDT... At 408 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springville to 8 miles south of Clarksville. Other strong storms were located from Vanleer to Bon Aqua. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Waverly, Centerville, Camden, Erin, Clarksville, White Bluff, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Tennessee Ridge, Hurricane Mills, Charlotte, Vanleer, Cumberland City, Slayden, Bon Aqua, Lyles, Palmyra, and Bucksnort. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 180. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Dickson; Hickman; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Stewart
